recipe_text: Quantity; 1200; Prepare 1200 grams of lamb shanks| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of salt| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of black pepper| Measurement; 30; Measure out 30 grams of olive oil| Measurement; 150; Measure out 150 grams of onion, chopped| Measurement; 100; Measure out 100 grams of carrot, chopped| Measurement; 100; Measure out 100 grams of celery, chopped| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of garlic, minced| Measurement; 480; Measure out 480 grams of stout beer| Measurement; 480; Measure out 480 grams of beef broth| Measurement; 30; Measure out 30 grams of tomato paste| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of thyme| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of rosemary| Untimed; None; Season lamb shanks with salt and black pepper| Untimed; None; Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat| Untimed; None; Brown lamb shanks on all sides, then remove and set aside| Untimed; None; Add onion, carrot, celery, and garlic to the Dutch oven and cook until softened| Untimed; None; Stir in stout beer, beef broth, tomato paste, thyme, and rosemary| Untimed; None; Return lamb shanks to the Dutch oven| Untimed; None; Cover and reduce heat to low| Timed; 14400; Simmer for 4 hours, or until lamb is tender| Finish; None; Serve hot and enjoy!
title: Stout Braised Lamb Shanks
